Legal_Issue: Whether the defendants infringed the plaintiffs' patent for a fabric with oppositely facing furry surfaces
Evidence_Assessment: Defendants' garments have fur on oppositely facing surfaces; natural twisting occurs in production process; reinforcement does not avoid infringement
Decision_Outcome: Defendants found liable for patent infringement
Legal_Rule: Infringement occurs when an act interferes with the monopoly granted by a patent; court must determine if the product falls within the scope of patent claims
Grounds_for_Claim: Manufacture and sale of garments using a method resulting in a product similar to the patented invention
Key_Evidence_Considered: Comparison of plaintiffs' patented fabric and defendants' product; analysis of manufacturing process
Legal_Framework: Patent rights and exclusivity under applicable patent law
Court_Result: Defendants liable for infringement of claims 1 to 4; permanent injunction awarded; damages and/or accounting of profits to be determined
Legal_Rule_Source: Statutory patent law and judicial interpretation
Defendant_Response: Denial of deliberate twisting; claim of different manufacturing method
Remedy_Requested: Permanent injunction, damages, and/or accounting of profits
Outcome: Permanent injunction granted; further proceedings for damages or profits
Remedy_Sought: Permanent injunction, damages, accounting of profits
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Damages and/or accounting of profits pending determination
Jurisdiction: Civil court with jurisdiction over intellectual property matters
Governing_Rule: Patent infringement rule based on product falling within scope of patent claims
